Articles.Content:
Done, thanks for the heads up.

no worries. I'll make it a point to warn you when I have a new release ready for test

Version 0.9.1 released!

This is an update to the ECLSS pack only!

Asmi's ECLSS Revived by Shasol has become Community Resource Pack compliant which means CO2 has been changed to Carbon Dioxide. This is great news for cross mod compatibility.

Universal Storage 0.9.1 updates the ECLSS pack only so that parts now use CarbonDioxide rather than CO2. If you don't use ECLSS pack then you don't need to change anything. If you do, then make sure you update to the latest version of ECLSS before updating the US ECLSS pack.

Full change log and download at ksp.kingtiger.co.uk
KAS has just released its .25 update. Let's see if it's compatible!
Hey guys, quick heads-up. You are still bundling MM 2.3.5, maybe it would be best to update it?

Hey guys, quick heads-up. You are still bundling MM 2.3.5, maybe it would be best to update it?

Yeah, I don't like to be an early adopter I'll test 2.5.1 tonight and if it's stable will update the download. 2.3.5 is working fine for me in 0.25 though.

KAS has just released its .25 update. Let's see if it's compatible!

Just tested it and it sure is.

Yeah, I don't like to be an early adopter I'll test 2.5.1 tonight and if it's stable will update the download. 2.3.5 is working fine for me in 0.25 though.

Apparently, I had an issue with the sci parts in Dmagic's mod not showing in US format after both have been updated to support 0.25 and it fixed itself with 2.5.1 Module Manager. Just a heads up.

Thank you very much for this great mod.

Version 0.9.1 released!

Sorry to bother but does 0.9.1 also include the updated USI Tools converters, I didn't see that in the patch notes on your site and since that came up after 0.9 was released I wasn't sure if they were incorporated somewhere in-between?

Sorry to bother but does 0.9.1 also include the updated USI Tools converters, I didn't see that in the patch notes on your site and since that came up after 0.9 was released I wasn't sure if they were incorporated somewhere in-between?

Yes it does. 9.0 and later uses USI_Convertor. It's in the change log for 0.9

Yes it does. 9.0 and later uses USI_Convertor. It's in the change log for 0.9

Ah, righto I just saw RoverDude's comment after the 0.9 announcement but before 0.9.1 and wondered if there was a further update to the converters
You might want to update USI tools in the core download to 0.2.3 that is built for KSP 0.25, AVC will tell you once you install US.

You might want to update USI tools in the core download to 0.2.3 that is built for KSP 0.25, AVC will tell you once you install US.

Thought I'd updated that yesterday, but apparently not (busy week). Thanks for the heads up, it's now up to date.
TAC LS just updated
The download page keeps giving me US_Core_0.9.0.242.zip. Is there a download of 0.9.1 somewhere?

For TAC LS there is a new configuration I'm pretty sure. The consumption rates part is unchanged. So you basically just copy the consumption section from the universal storage TAC LS human consumption mod cfg into the tac LS cfg replacing the same section.

If the OP wants to fix this it would only take a handful of seconds to upload the new config.

The download page keeps giving me US_Core_0.9.0.242.zip. Is there a download of 0.9.1 somewhere?

If you check the change log, only the ECLSS pack has changed in 0.9.1, for the core pack 0.9.0 is the latest release.
The USI Tools you are packing with US_Core 0.9.1 are outdated. New Version here: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/1fsuzvl35s2gppt/AAD8kNgBm6rO9m4paXmwuqA0a

The USI Tools you are packing with US_Core 0.9.1 are outdated. New Version here: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/1fsuzvl35s2gppt/AAD8kNgBm6rO9m4paXmwuqA0a

We pack 0.2.3 which is the latest version on the USI website. Although I'm not going to release a new version of US every time a dependency updates, as long as the packaged version is stable. Things like the USI toolkit and Module manager are in their own location and can be easily updated separately if you want to run the latest and greatest. USI-Toolkit even has it's own AVC file so (if enabled) it'll independently tell you when a new version is released.

I have just started using the new(ish) hexcore parts and I am loving this scale, really great for mixing filled and empty segments 3+3 for science and landing legs for neat little landers. (The AIES legs fit perfectly)

The only problem I am getting is the 1.85m diameter, I know this isnt a US issue, I'd just like to ask where would I get some nice adaptors to 'cap-off' the hexcore parts? I dont like having the ends exposed and its too big for 1.25 and too small for 2.5.

I have just started using the new(ish) hexcore parts and I am loving this scale, really great for mixing filled and empty segments 3+3 for science and landing legs for neat little landers. (The AIES legs fit perfectly)

The only problem I am getting is the 1.85m diameter, I know this isnt a US issue, I'd just like to ask where would I get some nice adaptors to 'cap-off' the hexcore parts? I dont like having the ends exposed and its too big for 1.25 and too small for 2.5.

Daishi is currently working on decouplers for the 3 core sizes. I'm not sure if they will also work as end caps, but it's a good idea.

I have been dying for metal plates of the three rocket sizes to work as caps or load bearers in situations where a structural fuselage is way too long. Some mod I have installed (Procedural Fairings?) has a 1.25m one, but it's apparently meant to split into multiple nodes and weighs far too much to behave as filler.

Universal Storage 0.9.1 updates the ECLSS pack

Thanks for your mod!

I think you need add Radial Carbon Dioxide Tank, like Radial Oxygen Tank.
Thank you for the excellent mod. Also for including an alternative Sabatier config with Methane output! This makes Zubrin type mission a whole lot simpler...
would it be possible for you to package just the service modules for those of us who are playing without life support mods.

would it be possible for you to package just the service modules for those of us who are playing without life support mods.

Already done! You'll want to download just the Core pack.
